page.title: 20Flavour of our Humour
page.content: A few years ago a French lorry driver knocked down the Pinnacle in Martock. Since then it has been re-built. With tongue in cheek this article appeared in a local paper:-A statement by Mr Tiny Spire a spokesman for the EEC, shook parish councils by giving details of a new metric ruling saying :'No Pinnacle over the height of 18 cm and width of 2 m will be allowed in any village in the SW of England.' One resident suggests that the council should get some obliging lorry driver to knock it down to size and then distribute the rock for local people's rockeries. Another suggested digging a hole under the Pinnacle and letting it drop to 18cm, then build a subway for people to see what it looks like. A 2m fence with a klaxon on top should warn people when a French lorry driver comes within four metres of the fence.
